definition: to make sense of sth
to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: Once he straightened out his ideas, he became cheerful again.
sentences.chinese: 他思想搞通了，精神也愉快了。

sentences.english: He thought thorough it, and the spirit was vivid, too.
sentences.chinese: 他思想搞通了，精神也就愉快了。

sentences.english: Don't ever assume that the grownups are figuring everything out.
sentences.chinese: 千万别假定大人把每一件事都搞通了。

definition: to get a good grasp of
to make sense of/to grasp the meaning of/to figure out
to follow good examples
lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
basic concept
basic issue/fundamental question
to learn by rote/to cram
fundamental principle
logical thinking
to learn by heart/to memorize
doctrine (religion)
to know by heart (so well that you can recite it backwards)
to understand what one is reading or watching
to understand/to comprehend the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
to learn by rote/to mechanically memorize
logic
